SENT.plain: Most esophageal malignancies are either squamous carcinomas or adenocarcinomas arising in the background of Barrett's esophagus
We describe a case of an 85-yr-old woman in whom the diagnosis of esophageal malignancy was difficult to confirm despite its endoscopic appearance and previous biopsies
This case illustrates the difficulty in diagnosing Hodgkin's disease of the esophagus
Despite the rarity of this entity, if clinically indicated by symptoms, large, deep biopsies by rigid esophagoscopy should be considered
